body: As said in 1:1 chat, some form of minimal reproducer would be great
thinking about it, I think I might be able to leverage akka streams tests verifying the lack of pending materializer actors when the test completes

issue.title: stream: register newshells with no active interpreters

labels.name: tested
labels.description: PR that was successfully built and tested by Jenkins

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
fixes #29730 .
akka-stream's actor graph interpreter failed to register new shells when current active interpreters where all completed.
The issue was first seen via `Flow.lazyFutureFlow` but is actually a specific issue of the actor graph interpreter exposed via `Flow.flatMapPrefix' and other operators built on top of it (i.e. `Flow.lazyFutureFlow`).

body: Great catch, you seem to be right. Really surprising that this never came up before.
Hello @jrudolph, does this issue also affect 2.5.32 branch? Will the fix be merged to 2.5.X?

> does this issue also affect 2.5.32 branch?

Yes, though 2.5.x didn't yet have the `flatMapPrefix` operator that run into the issue. Though, it's not really exclusive to `flatMapPrefix` and may show in other scenarios.

> Will the fix be merged to 2.5.X?

It's currently not planned, 2.5.x is only updated very infrequently at this point. Do you have a case where you observe the behavior also with 2.5.x?

>  Do you have a case where you observe the behavior also with 2.5.x?

No, no observation with 2.5.x. We started to use Akka-http in SW which uses Actors 2.5.x so We just analyzed the current open tickets.

> No, no observation with 2.5.x. We started to use Akka-http in SW which uses Actors 2.5.x so We just analyzed the current open tickets.

Thanks for the additional info. You can (and should) use Akka HTTP 10.2.x with Akka 2.6, so you will get the latest fixes for Akka as well.
